content: The best way to travel around Tokyo for tourists is by using the extensive public transportation system which includes trains, subways, buses, and taxis. The Tokyo Metro and JR lines cover most of the city's major sights and attractions, and their passes offer unlimited transportation for a certain duration of time. Tourists can also use IC cards such as Suica and Pasmo, which can be used on most public transportation in Tokyo. Walking is also a great way to explore the city, as many of the popular areas are within walking distance of each other. Additionally, there are bicycle rental services available in some areas of the city. Hiring a private guide or taking a tour may also be helpful for navigating Tokyo's complex transportation system and finding the best spots to visit.
